place.name: BULLINGTON
place.gazetteerText: BULLINGTON, a parish in Andover district, Hants; on an affluent of the river Test, 4 miles WNW of Mitcheldever r. station, and 4½ S of Whitchurch. Post Town, Barton-Stacey, under Winchester. Acres, 1,623. Real property, with Tufton, £3,134. Pop., 171. Houses, 37. The property is divided among a few. Bullington House is an old mansion. A Roman camp is at Tilbury Hill; and Roman antiquities have been found there. The living is a vicarage united with the vicarage of Tufton, in the diocese of Winchester. Value, £260.* Patron, W. Iremonger, Esq. The church is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
